name: direfully
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is very bad or unpleasant: He was attacked by a dangerous illness from which he suffered direfully throughout the whole campaign. We continued to suffer direfully from the violence of the ship's motion.
More examplesFewer examplesOur liberties are direfully threatened by this war.The huge bull suffered most direfully under the punishment.It is impossible for this to happen in the way that has been so direfully predicted by some of our colleagues.
